name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 5.9.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version 5.9.0.RELEASE. This release includes support for some new parts of the v3 CloudController API as well as the ability to have variable substitution in manifest files processed by the library.

* Add variable substitution in ApplicationManifestUtils (#1153 - thanks @luschmar)
* Allow null values in map of service parameters (#1159 - thanks @theghost5800)
* Implement service instances and plans creation and update (#1157 - thanks @IvanBorislavovDimitrov)
* Re-implement V3 Service Bindings (#1158 - thanks @radito3)
* Add LifecycleType for KPACK (#1162)

For a more detailed look at the changes in 5.9.0.RELEASE, please take a look at the issue tracker and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v5.8.0.RELEASE...v5.9.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 5.8.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version 5.8.0.RELEASE. This release includes a compatibility fix for using Spring Boot 2.5 dependencies and a fix that ensures the wiretap and proxy settings are consistently applied.

* Changes to SSLContext setup to handle deprecations in reactor-netty & boot 2.5 (#1140)
* Ensure that HTTP client is always configured (#1147)

For a more detailed look at the changes in 5.8.0.RELEASE, please take a look at the issue tracker and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v5.7.0.RELEASE...v5.8.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 4.17.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version 4.17.0.RELEASE. This release includes various bug fixes, some relating to issues caused by client-side validation. The supported CC API version is also bumped, and changes to handle the removal of the Deployment 'state' field are incorporated.

* Allow empty query params for V3 filtering & Fix build for Windows #1124 (with thanks to @radito3)
* Avoid NPE in DefaultApplications.java #1126 (with thanks to @marc-schaefers)
* Fixed issue with PR#1126 where compilation+unit tests failed with UnsupportedOperation #1129 
* Fix for comparison of unauthorised check #1136
* Fix parse of ProcessStatisticsResource with nullable fields #1134 (with thanks to @theghost5800)
* Marks a Deployment Resource's 'app' relationship property as Nullable #1137 
* Bumps Supported API version, handles removal of Deployment 'state' in 2_11+
* Set supported-api-version to 164 #1139

For a more detailed look at the changes in 4.17.0.RELEASE, please take a look at the issue tracker and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v4.16.0.RELEASE...v4.17.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 5.7.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version 5.7.0.RELEASE. This release includes various bug fixes, some relating to issues caused by client-side validation. The supported CC API version is also bumped, and changes to handle the removal of the Deployment 'state' field are incorporated.

* Bumps supported CC API version to 2.164
* Handles server-side removal of the Deployment 'state' property & tests
* #1124 Allow empty query params for V3 filtering & Fix build for Windows (with thanks to @radito3)
* #1126 Avoid NPE in DefaultApplications.java (thanks to @marc-schaefers)
* #1136 Fix for comparison of Unauthorised check
* #1134 Fix parse of ProcessStatisticsResource with nullable fields (thanks to @theghost5800)
* #1137 Marks a Deployment Resource's 'app' relationship property as Nullable

For a more detailed look at the changes in 5.7.0.RELEASE, please take a look at the issue tracker and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v5.6.0.RELEASE...v5.7.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 5.6.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version 5.6.0.RELEASE. This release has some improvements for v3 API compatibility (stacks & service brokers), and bug fixes. In particular, #1118 is important as this could cause long-running processes that use the cf-java-client to eventually run out of connections and possibly crash.

* CI changes for deploying with JFrog
* Updates to the README that include troubleshooting instructions, instructions for wire logging & tips for running CF locally for integration tests
* #1085 Use long instead of integer (with thanks to @IvanBorislavovDimitrov)
* #1064 Makes ProcessStatisticsResource validations aware of the state. (with thanks to @keviningvalson)
* #1088 Add support for V3 Stacks (with thanks to @radito3)
* #1080 Add Service Brokers Endpoints & service instance credentials/parameters (with thanks to @theghost5800)
* #1118 Ensure connections are closed in the event of a 401 & retry

For a more detailed look at the changes in 5.5.0.RELEASE, please take a look at the issue tracker and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v5.5.0.RELEASE...v5.6.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 4.16.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version 4.16.0.RELEASE. This release has some improvements for v3 API compatibility (stacks & service brokers), and bug fixes. In particular, #1118 is important as this could cause long-running processes that use the cf-java-client to eventually run out of connections and possibly crash.

* CI changes for deploying with JFrog
* Updates to the README that include troubleshooting instructions, instructions for wire logging & tips for running CF locally for integration tests
* #1085 Use long instead of integer (with thanks to @IvanBorislavovDimitrov)
* #1064 Makes ProcessStatisticsResource validations aware of the state. (with thanks to @keviningvalson)
* #1088 Add support for V3 Stacks (with thanks to @radito3)
* #1080 Add Service Brokers Endpoints & service instance credentials/parameters (with thanks to @theghost5800)
* #1118 Ensure connections are closed in the event of a 401 & retry

For a more detailed look at the changes in 4.16.0.RELEASE, please take a look at the issue tracker and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v4.15.0.RELEASE...v4.16.0.RELEASE).

For a more detailed look at the changes in 5.5.0.RELEASE, please take a look at the issue tracker and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v5.4.0.RELEASE...v5.5.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 5.0.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `5.0.0.RELEASE`. This release's theme is V3 functionality.

*Note: This is the first version in the `5.x` line. Many of its dependencies are now managed by Spring Boot 2.4, which means a non-trivial update in the underlying versions of Project Reactor dependencies we rely on. This may mean some refactoring is required from you. In addition the V3 Service Instances package has been renamed, which will require a straightforward refactor if you use that.*

* Added support for Automatic Module Names (with thanks to [Alexander Tsvetkov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/1071))
* Added support for Log Cache Client (with thanks to [Mike Heath](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/1053))
* Added support for V3 Buildpacks
* Added support for V3 Service Offerings
* Rename the `serviceInstances` package to `serviceinstances` for consistency.
* Dependency updates.

For a more detailed look at the changes in `5.0.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/88?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v4.12.0.RELEASE...v5.0.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 4.13.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `4.13.0.RELEASE`. This release's theme is V3 functionality.

* Added support for Automatic Module Names (with thanks to [Alexander Tsvetkov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/1071))
* Added support for Log Cache Client (with thanks to [Mike Heath](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/1053))
* Added support for V3 Buildpacks
* Added support for V3 Service Offerings

For a more detailed look at the changes in `4.13.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/87?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v4.12.0.RELEASE...v4.13.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 4.12.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `4.12.0.RELEASE`. This release's theme is V3 functionality.

_Note: This version now uses Spring Boot `2.3.x` to manage most of its dependencies. This should have no impact on functionality._

* Added support for V3 Service Plans
* Complete support for V3 Applications
* Added support for V3 Admin
* Dependency updates.

For a more detailed look at the changes in `4.12.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/86?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v4.11.0.RELEASE...v4.12.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 3.29.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `3.29.0.RELEASE`. This release's theme is V3 functionality.

_Note: This is the last planned version of the `3.x` line of the Java Client, based on the EOL of the underlying dependency management from Spring Boot `2.1.x`. We urge you to update to the current `4.x` line of the Java Client (based on Spring Boot `2.3.x`), or the soon to be released `5.x` line (based on the upcoming Spring Boot `2.4.x`)._

* Added support for V3 Service Plans
* Complete support for V3 Applications
* Added support for V3 Admin
* Dependency updates.

For a more detailed look at the changes in `3.29.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/85?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v3.28.0.RELEASE...v3.29.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 4.11.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `4.11.0.RELEASE`. This release's theme is updates.

_Note: This version now uses Spring Boot `2.3.x` to manage most of its dependencies. This should have no impact on functionality._

* Added Java 11 unit tests to the existing Java 8 tests (via [Guillaume Berche](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1067) and in part thanks [to him](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1069)). Note that Java 8 is still our default target.
* Fixed Enabling of Public Visibility (via [Arghya Sadhu](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/913), with thanks to [Alexander Tsvetkov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/994))
* Support for the latest version of the Cloud Foundry API (2.150.0)
* Dependency updates.

For a more detailed look at the changes in `4.11.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/84?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v4.10.0.RELEASE...v4.11.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 3.28.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `3.28.0.RELEASE`. This release's theme is updates.

_Note: This version uses Spring Boot `2.1.x` to manage most of its dependencies. That version of Spring Boot is expected to EOL before the end of the year. At that time we will stop making updates to the `3.x` line of the Java Client. We urge you to update to the current `4.x` line of the Java Client (based on Spring Boot `2.3.x`), or the soon to be released `5.x` line (based on the upcoming Spring Boot `2.4.`)._

* Added Java 11 unit tests to the existing Java 8 tests (via [Guillaume Berche](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1067) and in part thanks [to him](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1069)). Note that Java 8 is still our default target.
* Fixed Enabling of Public Visibility (via [Arghya Sadhu](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/913), with thanks to [Alexander Tsvetkov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/994))
* Support for the latest version of the Cloud Foundry API (2.150.0)
* Dependency updates.

For a more detailed look at the changes in `3.28.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/83?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v3.27.0.RELEASE...v3.28.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 4.10.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `4.10.0.RELEASE`. This release's highlight is increased support for V3 endpoints at the client level.

_Note: There is a known issue with the `4.1.51.Final` version of Netty that breaks application upload for us. Our current dependencies avoid that version, but you may see a problem if you override our choice in your own dependencies._

* Better handling of opaque refresh tokens (via [@sms0070](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1058))
* Fix the V3 application scaling request (with thanks to [Encho Belezirev](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/1010))
* Fix a potential error due to a reactor blocking call (with thanks to [Ben Hale](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/1068))
* Added support for the V3 Organizations and V3 Application Features endpoints.
* Documentation updates.

For a more detailed look at the changes in `4.10.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/82?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v4.9.0.RELEASE...v4.10.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 3.27.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `3.27.0.RELEASE`. This release's highlight is increased support for V3 endpoints at the client level.

_Note: There is a known issue with the `4.1.51.Final` version of Netty that breaks application upload for us. Our current dependencies avoid that version, but you may see a problem if you override our choice in your own dependencies._

* Better handling of opaque refresh tokens (via [@sms0070](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1058))
* Fix the V3 application scaling request (with thanks to [Encho Belezirev](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/1010))
* Fix a potential error due to a reactor blocking call (with thanks to [Ben Hale](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/1068))
* Added support for the V3 Organizations and V3 Application Features endpoints.
* Documentation updates.

For a more detailed look at the changes in `3.27.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/81?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v3.26.0.RELEASE...v3.27.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 4.9.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `4.9.0.RELEASE`. This release's highlight is support for multiple buildpacks.

_Note: There is a known issue with the `4.1.51.Final` version of Netty that breaks application upload for us. Our current dependencies avoid that version, but you may see a problem if you override our choice in your own dependencies._

* Enable support for multiple buildpacks when pushing an application (via [@parasuramln](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/921) and [Ilayaperumal Gopinathan](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1037))
* Adds support for v3 Routes (with thanks to [Encho Belezirev](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/1012))
* Rounds out support for v3 Spaces
* Allows for legacy health check types (via [Roman Bachmann](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/980))
* Adds `stack` to the data returned when fetching a buildpack (via [sai krishna](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1056))
* Dependency updates.

For a more detailed look at the changes in `4.9.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/80?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v4.8.0.RELEASE...v4.9.0.RELEASE).

For a more detailed look at the changes in `3.26.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/79?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v3.25.0.RELEASE...v3.26.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 4.8.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `4.8.0.RELEASE`. This release's highlight is much better handling of expired refresh tokens.

*Note: We've temporarily postponed the upgrade to the Spring Boot 2.3 line to iron out a dependency issue, but expect to go ahead with the upgrade in our next release.*

* Add support for v3 Events (with thanks to [Encho Belezirev](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/1014))
* Automatically obtains a new refresh token when the existing token expires (via [Alberto C. Ríos](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1026) and [Alexander Dietzsch](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1051))
* Adds wider support for maintenance info ([via](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1048) [Guillaume](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1050) [Berche](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1026))
* Enables logging of request IDs (via [@parasuramln](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/981))

For a more detailed look at the changes in `4.8.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/78?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v4.7.0.RELEASE...v4.8.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 3.25.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `3.25.0.RELEASE`. This release's highlight is much better handling of expired refresh tokens.

* Add support for v3 Events (with thanks to [Encho Belezirev](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/1014))
* Automatically obtains a new refresh token when the existing token expires (via [Alberto C. Ríos](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1026) and [Alexander Dietzsch](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1051))
* Adds wider support for maintenance info ([via](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1048) [Guillaume](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1050) [Berche](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1026))
* Enables logging of request IDs (via [@parasuramln](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/981))

For a more detailed look at the changes in `3.25.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/77?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v3.24.0.RELEASE...v3.25.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 4.7.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `4.7.0.RELEASE`. This release adds support for v3 Domains.

*Note: This is the final version of the 4.x line that will be based on Spring Boot 2.2 for its managed dependencies. The next release will update to Spring Boot 2.3.*

* Add support for v3 Domains (with thanks to [Yuxin Bai](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/1030))
* Improved the handling of some errors that result in a non-json response from the CF API.
* Dependency updates

For a more detailed look at the changes in `4.7.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/76?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v4.6.0.RELEASE...v4.7.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 3.24.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `3.24.0.RELEASE`. This release adds support for v3 Domains.

* Add support for v3 Domains (with thanks to [Yuxin Bai](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/1030))
* Improved the handling of some errors that result in a non-json response from the CF API.
* Dependency updates

For a more detailed look at the changes in `3.24.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/75?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v3.23.0.RELEASE...v3.24.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 4.6.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `4.6.0.RELEASE`. This release brings in a number of pull requests from our community.

* Add application ports when updating applications ([via](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/975) and with thanks to [Georg Friedrich](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/989))
* Correct Enums for Status Reasons and Values in V3 Deployments (via [@nickkomen](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1039))
* Make docker credentials nullable (with thanks to [Encho Belezirev](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/1011))
* Better customization options for the underlying HTTP client (with thanks to [Vasko Bozhurski](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/1040))
* Retrieve default domain (via [Kristian Atanasov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1004) and [Alexander Tsvetkov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1006), with thanks to [Alexander Tsvetkov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/1007))
* Correct encoding of plus signs in query parameters ([via](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1034) and with thanks to [Alexander Tsvetkov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/1036))
* Support metadata in v3 organizations and spaces (via [Arun Kumar Meenakshi Sundaram](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1027), with thanks to [@checketts](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/1031))
* Dependency updates

* Retrieve default domain (via [Kristian Atanasov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1004) and [Alexander Tsvetkov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1006), with thanks to [Alexander Tsvetkov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/1007))
* Correct encoding of plus signs in query parameters ([via](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1034) and with thanks to [Alexander Tsvetkov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/1036))
* Support metadata in v3 organizations and spaces (via [Arun Kumar Meenakshi Sundaram](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1027), with thanks to [@checketts](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/1031))

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 4.0.1.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `4.0.1.RELEASE`. This release is the first to make use of Spring Boot `2.2.x` to define our dependencies, the most significant result of which is that we now use the Reactor Netty `0.9.x` line and the corresponding Reactor Core `3.3.x` line

Despite the relatively small change in numbering from `0.7.x` to `0.9.x` this was actually a major update to Netty's public interface. All credit for tackling that goes to [Alexander Tsvetkov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/984), who produced probably the biggest PR in the project's history.

* Upgrade to Reactor Netty `0.9.x` (with thanks to [Alexander Tsvetkov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/984))
* Upgrade to Reactor Core `3.3.x` (via [Michael Minella](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/1003), thanks to Alexander's fix)
* Fix Reactor Netty version incompatibility with Spring WebFlux 5.1 WebClient (via [Scott Frederick](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/938), thanks to Alexander's fix)
* Fix Netty memory leaks (via [David O'Sullivan](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/903), thanks to Alexander's fix)
* General dependency updates.

For a more detailed look at the changes in `4.0.1.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/63?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v3.16.0.RELEASE...v4.0.1.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 3.17.1.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `3.17.1.RELEASE`. This release is the first to make use of Spring Boot `2.1.x` to define our dependencies, the most significant result of which is that we now use the Reactor Netty `0.8.x` line.

Despite the small change in numbering from `0.7.x` to `0.8.x` this was actually a major update to Netty's public interface. All credit for tackling that goes to [Alexander Tsvetkov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/984), who produced probably the biggest PR in the project's history.

* Upgrade to Reactor Netty `0.8.x` (with thanks to [Alexander Tsvetkov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/984))
* Fix Reactor Netty version incompatibility with Spring WebFlux 5.1 WebClient (via [Scott Frederick](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/938), thanks to Alexander's fix)
* Fix Netty memory leaks (via [David O'Sullivan](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/903), thanks to Alexander's fix)
* General dependency updates.

For a more detailed look at the changes in `3.17.1.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/61?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v3.16.0.RELEASE...v3.17.1.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 3.16.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `3.16.0.RELEASE`. This release contains improvements and fixes for a range of user-reported issues. Particular thanks to [Alexander Tsvetkov](https://github.com/nictas) for his substantial work on this release.

* Support pushing of applications from private Docker registries (via [@harald-luebeck](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/941), with thanks to [Alexander Tsvetkov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/959))
* Support filtering of builds based on package IDs ([via](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/985) and with thanks to [Alexander Tsvetkov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/986))
* Fix a JSON issue causing problems interacting with the networking API (via [Kirill Tolkachev](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/969), with thanks to [Georg Friedrich](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/990))
* Support pushing applications with 0 instances (with thanks to [Alexander Tsvetkov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/991))
* Support push with HTTP health-check endpoint (via [James Carman](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/970), with thanks to [Alexander Tsvetkov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/995))
* Include Docker attributes in application manifests (via [@vshetty001](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/942), with thanks to [Alexander Tsvetkov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/992))
* Support retrieval of service instance and service binding parameters ([via](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/987) and with thanks to [Alexander Tsvetkov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/988))
* Allow empty query parameters (with thanks to [Ivan Dimitrov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/978))
* Add support for v3 Application and Service metadata (with thanks to [Petko Boyadzhiev](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/966))
* Improve the developer experience for Windows and Eclipse users (with thanks to [Alexander Tsvetkov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/982))
* Fix cloning the project on Windows (via [Kristian Atanasov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/955))
* Align pom with Maven guidelines (via [Andy Wilkinson](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/976))
* Documentation updates (via [José Fernando Santos de Carvalho](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/950) and [Glenn Oppegard](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/944), with thanks to [Alexander Tsvetkov](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/996))
* General dependency updates.

For a more detailed look at the changes in `3.16.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/60?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v3.15.0.RELEASE...v3.16.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 3.14.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `3.14.0.RELEASE`. This release focuses on compatibility with the latest version of Cloud Foundry.

* Updates to work with v2.120.0 of the Cloud Controller API
* Improve backwards compatibility of the V3 Service Instances API (via [Nico Schmoigl](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/909))
* Support unit indicators in application manifests (via [@parasuramln](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/911))
* Remove blocking errors caused by a change in reactor (via [Scott Frederick](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/914))
* Improve handling of optional fields in client tokens (with thanks to [Mike Heath](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/916))
* Support user provided service tags (with thanks to [Mike Heath](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/920))
* Remove extraneous tests (via [Mike Heath](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/919))
* Fix error when getting a user summary (via [Mohneesh Damade](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/917))
* Handle application names that include '.' when creating routes (via [@parasuramln](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/918))
* Support third party identity providers (via [@andreaAlkalay](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/923), with thanks to [@pavellom](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/924))
* Handle users with no name when listing users (via [Chris Phillipson](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/926))
* Make updating a service instance an asynchronous operation (via [Scott Frederick](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/929))
* Handle time zones that are not a whole number of hours offset from UTC
* Dependency and test updates.

For a more detailed look at the changes in `3.14.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/56?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v3.13.0.RELEASE...v3.14.0.RELEASE).

body:

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 3.2.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `3.2.0.RELEASE`.  This release focuses on Container to Container Networking.

* Add support for Container to Container Networking at the client and operations layer (via [Andrew Fitzgerald](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/801))
* Clarify Disk Quota units (via [Andrew Fitzgerald](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/831))
* Protect against NPE when working with Droplets (via [@patsys](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/825))
* Improved compatibility with earlier versions of Cloud Foundry ([Cheuk Lam](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/817))
* Add ability to invalidate some cached items (via [Mike Youngstrom](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/749))
* General improvements around caching and logging.

For a more detailed look at the changes in `3.2.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/34?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v3.1.0.RELEASE...v3.2.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 3.0.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `3.0.0.RELEASE`.  This release focuses CAPI 2.94.0 compatibility.  This release is the first on the 3.x line which uses Reactor 3.1 instead of Reactor 3.0.  Both the 3.x and 2.x branches will continue to be developed in parallel giving users a chance to migrate from Reactor 3.0 to Reactor 3.1.

* Support for the CAPI 2.94.0 API release
* Unable to query recent application logs (via [Steven Swor](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/818))

For a more detailed look at the changes in `3.0.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/30?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v2.19.0.RELEASE...v3.0.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 2.17.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `2.17.0.RELEASE`.  This release focuses lots of bug fixes.

* Improve error messages for manifests missing required keys (via [Bjoern Schoof](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/790))
* Enable manifest `disk_quota` to be specified with units (via [Steven Swor](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/793))
* Enable `UaaClient` to be used standalone (via [David Rennalls](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/791))
* Handle `STAGING_ERROR` when getting instance status (via [Justin Braathen](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/799))
* Improved pushing applications on Windows (via [@cwesdorp](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/780))
* Upgrade Existing Cloud Controller V3 APIs to GA contracts
* Additional Cloud Controller V3 APIs
* Additional Stack APIs
* Additional Integration Tests

For a more detailed look at the changes in `2.17.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/26?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v2.16.0.RELEASE...v2.17.0.RELEASE).

body:

* CF API 2.82.0 (and concurrent) support
* Support for new health check types (via [Nieraj Singh](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/764))
* Upgraded Reactor Netty improving connection lifecycle (via [Kris De Volder](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/746))
* Propagate Health Check HTTP Endpoint (via [Kris De Volder](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/765))
* Support for relative paths in manifest parser (via [Kris De Volder](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/766))
* Improve TCP Route manifest support (via [Kris De Volder](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/767))
* Improve TCP Route manifest support (via [Kris De Volder](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/769))
* Improve TCP Route manifest support (via [Kris De Volder](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/770))
* Improve HTTP Route manifest support (via [Kris De Volder](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/771))
* TCP Route port info (via [Kris De Volder](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/768))
* Additional Client Application APIs


For a more detailed look at the changes in `2.14.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/23?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v2.13.0.RELEASE...v2.14.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 2.12.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `2.12.0.RELEASE`.  This release focuses on bug fixes when pushing applications using resource matching.

* Added `dispose()` method to `DefaultConnectionContext` to allow cleanup before discard (via [Kris De Volder](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/745))
* Added phone number to create and update user UAA Client APIs (via [@gkhunger](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/753))
* Add Identity Zone configuration to `TokenProviders` and `ReactorUaaClient` (via [Alain Michaud](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/751))
* Added Service Access Client APIs (via [Andrea Alkalay](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/729))
* Added User Information UAA Client APIs (via [@Luyang1208](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/752))

For a more detailed look at the changes in `2.12.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/21?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v2.11.0.RELEASE...v2.12.0.RELEASE).

* Replaced [Broken](https://github.com/netty/netty/issues/5478) Netty HTTP Post Handler (via [@jonbuck16](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/738))
* Improved Integration Tests

For a more detailed look at the changes in `2.11.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/20?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v2.10.0.RELEASE...v2.11.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 2.10.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `2.10.0.RELEASE`.  This release focuses on pushing applications using manifests

* 🎉 Push applications using manifests, both YAML and programmatic 🎉 
* Disabled chunked transfer encoding to match CLI (via [@stipx](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/739))

For a more detailed look at the changes in `2.10.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/19?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v2.9.0.RELEASE...v2.10.0.RELEASE).

body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `2.9.0.RELEASE`.  This release focuses on some minor improvements and partially completes the work for pushing with application manifests

* Proper nullability on Service Usage Events (via [Sebastien Bortolussi](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/717))

For a more detailed look at the changes in `2.8.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/17?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v2.7.0.RELEASE...v2.8.0.RELEASE).

body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version `2.6.0.RELEASE`.  This release reinstates an API that allowed the extraction of the current refresh token for a user.

* Additional Integration Tests

For a more detailed look at the changes in `2.6.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/15?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v2.5.0.RELEASE...v2.6.0.RELEASE).

A special thanks to the Spring Cloud Data Flow for beating on the client and helping us find and test areas for improvement.

For a more detailed look at the changes in `2.4.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/13?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v2.3.0.RELEASE...v2.4.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 2.1.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm pleased to announce the release of the Cloud Foundry Java Client, version 2.1.0.RELEASE.  
- Fixed a long running issue reading messages from Doppler sources (via [Biju Kunjummen](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/502) and [Benjamin Einaudi](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/551))
- Map and umap route operations handling paths at all times (via [David Ehringer](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/570))
- Improve get application operation in the face of a failed staging (via [Mohan Pindyala](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/573))
- Improve events listing (via [Jeff Dean](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/578))
- Creation of TCP Routes (via [Vasanth Loka](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/583))
- Allow binding of services with `null` values in credentials map (via [Mike Youngstrong](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/574))
- Remove deprecated Doppler types (via [Guillaume Berche](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pull/582))
- Send token request payload is body instead of query parameters (via [Mike Youngstrom](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/571))
- Added the Routing V1 API
- Added Refresh Token Grant and One Time Passcode Token Providers
- Additional UAA Client APIs
- Added Route Services APIs and Operations
- Additional Security Group APIs
- Support for PCF 1.8 and 1.9

For a more detailed look at the changes in `2.1.0.RELEASE`, please take a look at the [issue tracker](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/milestone/9?closed=1) and [commit log](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/v2.0.0.RELEASE...v2.1.0.RELEASE).

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 2.0.0.RELEASE
body:
I'm immensely pleased to announce Cloud Foundry Java Client `2.0.0.RELEASE`!  This release is the culmination of 54 weeks of work, encompassing 10 milestones, two release candidates, and [2,344 commits](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/compare/dc8f8d5c8370de223992a0e4a024d5cff082a682...v2.0.0.RELEASE).

Before the typical discussion about the release, I'd like to take a moment to recognize everyone who contributed to the success of this effort:
- [Steve Powell](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/commits?author=Zteve)
- [Chris Frost](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/commits?author=cgfrost)
- [Benjamin Einaudi](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/commits?author=antechrestos)
- [Paul Harris](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/commits?author=twoseat)
- [Glyn Normington](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/commits?author=glyn)
- [Lokesh Kumar N](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/commits?author=LokeshN)
- [Olivier Orand](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/commits?author=o-orand)
- [Sebastien Bortolussi](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/commits?author=s-bortolussi)
- [Stephane Maldini](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/commits?author=smaldini)
- [Ben Patterson](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/commits?author=benpatt)
- [Mike Heath](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/commits?author=mheath)
- [Ramnivas Laddad](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/commits?author=ramnivas)
- [William Gautier](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/commits?author=WGautier)

It really makes me happy to see that more than half of the contributors to the project are from outside of Pivotal.  I see this as an indication both that we're fulfilling a wide-spread need and that we've created an environment that encourages external contribution.  I encourage anyone else interested in contributing to join this list over the coming months.

Next, I'd like to recognize the lead of [Project Reactor](https://projectreactor.io) Stephane Maldini, for his tireless efforts to help us deliver an incredible reactive API.  When we took the decision to head in this direction, Stephane stepped up to teach the entire team the principles behind reactive programming.  This effort was non-trivial, entailing hundreds of hours on [Screenhero](https://screenhero.com) often until after one in the morning for him.  The last year has easily been the greatest example of two projects evolving together, that I have ever experienced.  The amount of improvement Reactor and the Java Client have driven in each other cannot be overestimated.

Finally I'd like to thank the teams that started building on the Java Client, long before it was production ready.  Projects like [Spring Cloud Data Flow](https://github.com/spring-cloud/spring-cloud-dataflow) and [Spring Cloud Spinnaker](https://github.com/spring-cloud/spring-cloud-spinnaker) have been invaluable tools for driving usability and bug fixes.

And now onto the release!

---

This release was a [complete re-write](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/commit/dc8f8d5c8370de223992a0e4a024d5cff082a682) of the Java Client with a focus on:
- two cleanly delineated APIs; a `-client` API mapping to the REST calls and an `-operations` API mapping to CLI
- implementing every single REST call exposed by all Cloud Foundry components (more than 500 individual URIs across 4 components)
- an airtight separation between APIs and implementation; a Reactor-based default is provided, and alternate implementations are possible
- a reactive API based on Project Reactor and interoperable with any [Reactive Streams](http://www.reactive-streams.org)-compatible library

_For more detail on these goals, please see the [2.0.0.M1 Release Notes](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/releases/tag/v2.0.0.M1)_

For detailed information on how to use the client, the [README](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/tree/v2.0.0.RELEASE) is the best place to start.  Javadocs for the library can be found at [`cloudfoundry-client`](http://cloudfoundry.github.io/cf-java-client/api/latest-release/cloudfoundry-client), [`cloudfoundry-client-reactor`](http://cloudfoundry.github.io/cf-java-client/api/latest-release/cloudfoundry-client-reactor), [`cloudfoundry-operations`](http://cloudfoundry.github.io/cf-java-client/api/latest-release/cloudfoundry-operations), and [`cloudfoundry-util`](http://cloudfoundry.github.io/cf-java-client/api/latest-release/cloudfoundry-util).  Since usage requires a fair bit of knowledge about the workings of the Cloud Foundry APIs themselves, check out the docs for the [Cloud Controller V2](http://apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/latest-release), [V3](http://v3-apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/version/release-candidate/index.html), [Doppler](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/loggregator/tree/develop/src/trafficcontroller#endpoints), and the [UAA](http://docs.cloudfoundry.com/uaa).

While the Java Client implements a great many of the Cloud Foundry APIs we didn't manage to complete them _all_.  By our count we're about 80% the way through and have delivered all of the commonly used endpoints.  Over the coming months we'll be continuing to deliver the missing implementations until everything is complete.  Beyond that, we're committed to keeping the library up to date with Cloud Foundry's evolving API.

We welcome all feedback from the community and look forward to seeing you [open issues](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues) and [submit pull requests](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/pulls).  If you're looking for help and discussion we're lurking in the [Cloud Foundry Slack](https://cloudfoundry.slack.com/messages/java-client/) during European and North American working hours.

We hope that the new Java Client is useful for everyone and can't wait to see what you build with it.

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 2.0.0.RC2
body:
I'm pleased to announce our second release candidate.  This release fixes a pair of bugs reported as part of the release candidate cycle.  As before, this release continues an API freeze in anticipation of a final release in the near future.
- Doppler Envelopes did not expose Counter Events
- Pushing Docker Images did not configuration application properly.

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 2.0.0.RC1
body:
After an epic development cycle, we're finally approaching the finish line.  I'm please to announce our eleventh milestone release and our first release candidate!  The release marks an API freeze in anticipation of a final release in the near future.  If you've been holding out before now, this is a good release to start testing against.
- Additional UAA Client API implementations
- Additional CF Shared Domain API implementations
- Additional CF Space Quota Definition API implementations
- Additional timeout configuration options
- Improved streaming of logs through proxies
- Improved Integration Test coverage

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 2.0.0.M10
body:
Following along quickly, I'm pleased to announce our tenth milestone release!  This milestone fixes a horrible bug that made the client unusable after UAA tokens expired (typically five minutes).

Like last time, we expect the next milestone to be a release candidate (RC1) after which the API will be frozen for the release.  This release makes some minor breaking API changes dealing with how applications and buildpacks are uploaded and as before we're still evaluating _significantly_ wider usage of `Optional` in the API.
- Additional UAA Client API implementations
- Use of `InputStream`s in the Operations layer are now uses of `Path`
- All provided `TokenProvider`s now refresh the token shortly before it expires
- All Resource Matching Client API implementations
- Improved Integration Test coverage

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 2.0.0.M9
body:
After an extended delay, I'm pleased to announce the our ninth milestone release.  This milestone is a big one tidying up a ton of loose ends, making breaking API changes, and renaming artifacts.  I **highly** recommend reviewing the `README` to [verify the names and versions of dependent artifacts](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/tree/v2.0.0.M9#cloud-foundry-java-client) as well as how [to instantiate the `Client`s and `Operations`](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/tree/v2.0.0.M9#usage).

We expect the next milestone to be a release candidate (RC1) after which the API will be frozen for the release.  We expect some more breaking API changes before that milestone dealing with how applications and buildpacks are uploaded as well as _significantly_ wider usage of `Optional` in the API.
- `cloudfoundry-client-spring` artifact is now called `cloudfoundry-client-reactor`
- All `*Client` builder APIs have changed and are now consistent with one another
- All Doppler APIs now return envelopes along with payloads
- Streaming Log Operation now sorts entries (as best it can)
- Full proxy support
- Additional `PaginationUtils` for all existing paginated request and response types (CF V2, CF V3, UAA)
- Complete removal of [Lombok](https://projectlombok.org/index.html) in lieu of [Immutables](http://immutables.github.io)
- Complete removal of Spring from network path in lieu of Reactor
- Fixed an ancient bug that prevent the client from working with BlueMix or Helion
- Additional UAA Authorization API implementations
- Additional UAA Client API implementations
- Additional UAA Group API implementations
- Additional Security Group operation implementations
- Improved Integration Test coverage

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 2.0.0.M8
body:
As the eighth of our fortnightly milestone releases, this release focuses on UAA APIs..
- Additional UAA Authorization API implementations
- Additional UAA Identity Provider API implementations
- Additional UAA Group API implementations
- Additional UAA User API implementations
- Additional Security Group operation implementations
- The `ssh-code` operation implementation
- Much more liberal response deserialization, allowing much more to be `null`
- Significantly improved performance of large uploads and downloads
- Improved Integration Test coverage

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 2.0.0.M7
body:
As the seventh of our fortnightly milestone releases, this milestone continues the continues our move onto [Immutables](http://immutables.github.io) based request and response types.  It also continues adding CF Client and UAA API implementations as well as Operations.
- Updated to be compatible with latest versions of Reactor and Reactor Netty
- Updates to dependencies

- Additional Service Admin operation implementations
- Improved Integration Test coverage

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 2.0.0.M6
body:
As the sixth of our fortnightly milestone releases, this milestone continues the move onto a Reactor Netty based network stack.  It also continues adding CF Client and UAA API implementations as well as Operations.
- Added proxy support
- Additional Client Service Broker operation implementations
- Additional UAA Token API implementations
- Complete Service Keys API implementations
- Complete V3 Service Bindings API implementations
- Fixed bug that prevented empty collections from being sent to the server
- Improved Integration Test coverage
- Migrated existing Client V3 Buildpacks, V3 Packages, Private Domains, Route Mappings, Routes, Security Groups, Service Brokers, Service Instances, Service Keys, Service Plans, Service Plan Visibilities, Services, Service Usage Events, Shared Domains, Space Quota Definitions, Spaces, and User Provided Service instances to Reactor Netty implementation

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 2.0.0.M5
body:
As the fifth of our fortnightly milestone releases, this milestone begins the move onto a Reactor Netty based network stack.  It also completes the Doppler Client API.

- Additional Buildpacks Operations API implementations
- Additional Security Group Client API implementations

- Improved Integration Test coverage

As the fourth of our fortnightly milestone releases, this milestone updates us to Reactor Core `2.5.0.M4` and adds a number of new Client APIs and Operations APIs.

- Fixed serious bug in `PaginationUtils` that resulted in only collections being returned

- Additional Buildpacks Operations API implementations
- Additional Domains Operations API implementations

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 2.0.0.M2
body:
As the second of our fortnightly milestone releases, this milestone contains a number of improvements based on the usage for the previous milestone.
- `Applications.delete()` will remove application with bound services ([#419](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/419))
- Conformance with the V3 `Package.upload()` behavior
- Addition of missing `CreateApplicationRequest.ports` argument ([#420](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/420))
- OSGi `ClassLoader` compatibility ([#423](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/issues/423))
- User configurable staging and start timeouts in the Operations API

name: Cloud Foundry Java Client 2.0.0.M1
body:
As some of you may know, the Cloud Foundry Java Client has gone through various levels of neglect over the past couple of years.  Towards the end of last year, my team started working on the project with the goal of making it a piece of software that we were not only proud of, but that we could build towards the future with.  With that in mind, I’m exceedingly pleased to announce our 2.0.0.M1 release.

We’ve taken the opportunity of this major release to reset what the project is:
-  What was a once hodgepodge of Java APIs both mapping directly onto the REST APIs and onto higher-level abstractions is now two clearly delineated APIs.  We expose a `-client` API mapping to the REST calls and an `-operations` API mapping to the higher-level abstractions that roughly match the CLI.
- What once was an implementation of a subset of the Cloud Foundry APIs is now a target of implementing every single REST call exposed by any Cloud Foundry component (nearly 500 individual URIs across 4 components)
- What was once a co-mingled interface and Spring-based implementation is now an airtight separation between the two allowing alternate implementations (addressing one of the largest complaints about the previous generation)
- Finally, we’ve chosen to make the API reactive, building on top of Project Reactor, but interoperable with any Reactive Streams compatible library

Obviously, the biggest change in this list is the move to a reactive API.  This decision was not take lightly.  In fact our original V2 implementation was imperative following the pattern of the V1 effort.  However, after consulting with both internal and external users, we found that many teams were viewing “blocking” APIs as a serious issue as they implemented their high-performance micro-service architectures.  

As an example, we worked very deeply with a team right at the beginning as they were creating a new Cloud Foundry Routing Service.  Since each HTTP request into their system went though this service, performance was a primary concern and they were finding that the blocking bit of their implementation (Java Client V1) was the biggest hit for them.  We’ve mitigated a lot of the performance bottle neck with what we’ve got today, but for M2 we’re planning on removing that last blocking component completely and moving to a full non-blocking network stack.  This isn’t an isolated use case either, we’ve been seeing a lot of this theme; micro-service architectures require throughput that can’t be achieved without either a non-blocking stack or “massive” horizontal scaling.  Most companies would prefer the former simply due to cost.

As a general rule you can make a reactive api blocking (just tack `.get()` onto the end of any Reactor flow) but cannot make a blocking API non-blocking (see the insanity we do to fake it, with non-optimal results, on [RestTemplate](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/blob/c35c20463fab0e7730bf807af9e84ac186cdb3c2/cloudfoundry-client-spring/src/main/lombok/org/cloudfoundry/spring/util/AbstractSpringOperations.java#L73-L127) today).  So since we had a strong requirement to support this non-blocking design we figured that going reactive-first was the most flexible design we could choose.

If you want to get started with this new version, I’m sad to say that we’re a bit lacking in the “on boarding experience” at the moment.  We don’t have examples or a user-guide, but the repository’s [README](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client) is a good place to start.  As you progress deeper into using the client, you can probably piece something together from the [Javadocs](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client#documentation) and the [Cloud Foundry API](https://apidocs.cloudfoundry.org/latest-release/) documentation.  Finally, the best examples are found in our [integration tests](https://github.com/cloudfoundry/cf-java-client/blob/master/integration-test/src/test/java/org/cloudfoundry/operations/RoutesTest.java#L114-L135).  Improving this experience is something we’re quite sensitive to, so you can expect significant improvements here.

The reason that we’re laying this foundation is you.  We’re already seeing customers adopting (and contributing back to!) the project, but we’ve really done it to accelerate the entire Cloud Foundry ecosystem.  If you need to interact with Cloud Foundry, I want you to be using the Java Client.  If you find that it’s not the best way for you to get your work done, I want you to tell me, loudly and often.  We’re also excited about being in the vanguard of reactive APIs within the Java ecosystem.  Having recently experienced it, I’m sure that this transition will not be trivial, but I am sure that it’ll be worthwhile.

A special thanks goes out to Scott Fredrick (Pivotal) for nursing the project along far enough for us to take over, Benjamin Einaudi (Orange Telecom) for his constant submissions, and of course Chris Frost (Pivotal), Glyn Normington (Pivotal), Paul Harris (Pivotal), and Steve Powell (Pivotal) for doing so much of the hard work.
